benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/catalog/xml - Retrieve the full catalog as XML

covered: Valid Request: Successful retrieval covered for no params, requestedDate, accountId, and both together (TC01–TC04), asserting 200 and Content-Type text/xml with valid XML.
Empty Response: Covered both no catalog data (404/400) and empty catalog content (200 with valid empty XML) (TC05, TC15).

Query Parameters: Broad coverage of valid/invalid combinations, including non-matching requestedDate (TC06), invalid formats (TC07–TC08), extra unsupported params handling (TC09), max lengths (TC16), and injection attempts (TC13).
Authorization: Unauthorized (401) and forbidden (403) scenarios validated (TC10–TC11).
Resilience/Errors beyond guidelines: Service unavailable (503), timeout (504), retry after transient failure (TC12, TC14, TC22).
Performance and scalability: Large catalogs, concurrency, and peak-load behavior validated (TC17–TC18, TC21).
XML quality and compatibility: Well-formed XML and backward-compatibility assertions present (TC19–TC20).
gaps: Rate Limiting: No scenarios verifying throttling behavior or 429 Too Many Requests with retry headers.
Caching Behavior: No validation of ETag/Last-Modified/Cache-Control headers, nor conditional GET flows (If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since leading to 304 Not Modified).
Accept header/content negotiation: No tests for Accept: application/xml vs text/xml, or 406 Not Acceptable when unsupported types are requested.
Account-specific feature gating: No scenario defining behavior when accountId is provided but tenant-specific catalog features are disabled (ignore vs error).
Error response contract: No assertions on error response Content-Type and standardized structure (e.g., problem details), beyond presence of a generic error message.
recommendations: Add rate limiting tests: burst requests triggering 429 with Retry-After and rate-limit headers; verify backoff behavior and recovery.

Add caching tests: assert ETag and/or Last-Modified plus Cache-Control on 200 responses; exercise conditional GET with If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since returning 304 when unchanged and 200 when changed.
Include content negotiation scenarios: vary Accept header (text/xml, application/xml, */*); verify 200 with correct Content-Type and 406 for unsupported types.
Clarify non-applicability of pagination for this endpoint; optionally add a test asserting absence of pagination headers or that any pagination params are rejected/ignored per spec.
Define and test behavior when tenant-specific features are disabled and accountId is supplied (expected status and message).
Strengthen XML validation by asserting against a concrete XSD schema (not just well-formed), and verify charset in Content-Type (e.g., text/xml; charset=UTF-8).
Add an Internal Server Error simulation (500) to cover unexpected failures and verify consistent error contract.
Add boundary/timezone tests for requestedDate (UTC offsets, daylight saving boundaries, far past/future dates) to ensure correct version selection.
